title: 107_s833
content: The "Child Tax Credit Expansion and Equity Act" increases the amount allowed for the child tax credit and makes it partially refundable. The applicable amount for each qualifying child is determined based on the taxpayer's taxable year. The applicable amount for the child tax credit increases annually from $600 in 2002 to $1,000 in 2006 and beyond. The credit is limited based on the taxpayer's regular tax liability. The tax code is amended to adjust the calculation of excess tax liability and allowable credits for the taxable year. Amendments include changes to sections 24(d) and 26(a) of the tax code. Amendments are made to sections 24 and 26 of the tax code, including changes to the calculation of excess tax liability and allowable credits for the taxable year. Section 24 is amended to include limitations and adjustments based on adjusted gross income. Section 26 is amended to exclude section 24 from certain provisions. Additionally, a portion of the child credit is treated as refundable under section 24(d). The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to increase the credits for families with 3 or more children. The total credits allowed to a taxpayer will be increased by the credits for qualifying children, up to a maximum of $500 per child. This credit will not be considered part of the overall credit and will reduce the amount of credit otherwise allowable. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to increase credits for families with 3 or more children, up to $500 per child. Coordination with means-tested programs for eligibility purposes is also addressed. The amendments to the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 increase credits for families with 3 or more children, up to $500 per child. Income limitations apply for eligibility, and any refunds received under this subsection are not considered income. The effective date for these changes is for taxable years beginning after December 31, 2001.
